summary: This bill, the Incorporating National Support for Unprecedented Risks and Emergencies Act (INSURE Act), mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to establish a catastrophic property loss reinsurance program. This program provides reinsurance for primary insurance companies, covering perils like wind, hurricane, wildfire, severe convective storm, flood, and earthquake. It outlines eligibility criteria for insurers, sets premium structures, creates an advisory committee, establishes a Federal Catastrophe Reinsurance Fund, and mandates data collection. The bill also includes pilot programs for long-term property insurance policies and reports on relocation funds and earthquake coverage.
